localizedDescriptions.en: Interaction, contact or care event between a subject of care and healthcare provider(s).
A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
Summary of vaccination administration for a single infectious disease or agent, or a group of infectious diseases or agents that are vaccinated simultaneously using a combination vaccine.
Name of the vaccine administered.

annotations.comment: The vaccine name may contain a generic or trade name for a vaccine, the name of a combination vaccine, or a category of vaccine. For example: Measles vaccine; Measles Mumps Rubella (MMR) or 'Measles-containing vaccine'. Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: Status of the primary (or catch up) course of vaccinations.

annotations.comment: This status should be revised if the course has not been completed and the 'Next vaccination due' date or 'Next review due' has passed.

localizedDescriptions.en: Series of questions and associated answers used to screen for the administration of vaccination.

annotations.comment: The answers may be self-reported.

localizedDescriptions.en: Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Is there a history of administration of any vaccinations related to the screening purpose?

annotations.comment: In a template, the data element would usually be renamed to the specific question asked. The proposed value set can be adapted for local use by using the DV_TEXT or the DV_BOOLEAN datatypes choice to match each specific use case.

localizedDescriptions.en: Is there a history of administration of any vaccinations related to the screening purpose?
Is there a history of administration of any vaccinations related to the screening purpose?
Is there a history of administration of any vaccinations related to the screening purpose?
A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
Summary or persistent information about an individual's current and past jobs and/or roles.
A single job or role carried out by an individual during a specified period of time.
The main job title or the role of the individual.

annotations.comment: For example: Chief Executive Officer; Carer; or Student. Each of these job titles or roles may be comprised of multiple duties.

localizedDescriptions.en: The date when an individual commenced the job or role.

localizedDescriptions.en: Individual has never smoked any type of tobacco.
Individual is a current smoker of tobacco.
Individual has previously smoked tobacco but is not a current smoker.
The date or partial date when the individual first started frequent or regular, but usually non-daily, smoking of tobacco of any type.

annotations.comment: Can be a partial date, for example, only a year. For example, this date could represent when the individual commenced smoking every Friday night or at parties.

localizedDescriptions.en: Details about smoking activity for a specified type of smoked tobacco.
The type of tobacco smoked by the individual.

list.label: Sama banyaknya filter dan bukan filter

localizedDescriptions.en: Details about a discrete period of smoking activity for the specified type of tobacco.
Estimate of number of units of the specified type of tobacco consumed.

annotations.comment: For example: the number of 'sticks' or 'full pipes' per day or per week. This data element is redundant if a value is recorded for 'Typical use(mass)'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual.

annotations.comment: Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.

children.name: Usia pertama kali hamil

localizedDescriptions.en: Estimated or actual date/time the diagnosis or problem was recognised by a healthcare professional.

annotations.comment: Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of clinical recognition" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.

children.aqlPath: /content[openEHR-EHR-SECTION.adhoc.v1,'Khusus Wanita']/items[openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis.v1,'Usia Pertama kali hamil dan melahirkan']/data[at0001]/items[at0003,'Usia pertama kali hamil']/value

children.name: Usia pertama kali melahirkan

localizedDescriptions.en: Estimated or actual date/time of resolution or remission for this problem or diagnosis, as determined by a healthcare professional.

annotations.comment: Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of resolution" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.

children.aqlPath: /content[openEHR-EHR-SECTION.adhoc.v1,'Khusus Wanita']/items[openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis.v1,'Usia Pertama kali hamil dan melahirkan']/data[at0001]/items[at0030,'Usia pertama kali melahirkan']/value

Details about a specific procedure or grouping of procedures relevant for the screening purpose.
Name of a procedure or grouping of procedures.

annotations.comment: Coding of the 'Procedure name' with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: Timing of the procedure.

annotations.comment:
"The 'Timing' data element has deliberately been loosely modelled to support the myriad of ways that it can be used in questionnaires to capture when a procedure was performed. The specific and intended semantics can be further clarified in a template.
For example: 
Date/time for when the procedure was performed. Interval of date/time for a period of time eg. between 1940 and 1942. Text for descriptions like 'Immediately after the operation', or 'Up to one week ago', 'Up to two weeks ago', 'Three weeks ago'. Duration for the individual's age at the onset. Interval of Duration for the approximate age of the individual at the time of onset.

localizedDescriptions.en: Timing of the procedure.

It is not known whether any problems are present or absent.
The relationship of the family member to the individual.

annotations.comment: For example: mother, step-father, maternal grandmother, or paternal uncle. Coding of the relationship with a terminology is preferred, where possible and including specification of maternal and paternal as required.

localizedDescriptions.en: Age of the family member at diagnosis.
